JUDGES: Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
From DATE until DATE the applicant was detained in FAC . On DATE he was released .
The applicant submitted that he had been held in inadequate living and sanitary conditions . In particular , all the cells which he had occupied were overcrowded .

From DATE to DATE the applicant was detained in cell no . CARDINAL , which measured QUANTITY and was shared by CARDINAL people at a time . The cell was furnished with CARDINAL bunk beds , CARDINAL tables and a number of stools . A bathroom with a toilet cubicle and a washbasin were accessible from the cell . There was CARDINAL window , which was partly covered by a bunk bed .

The applicant did not make any statements as to whether or not he lodged any complaints with the penitentiary authorities regarding the conditions of his detention or any other aspect of his detention in ORG .
He submitted , however , among other documents , ORG copies of CARDINAL letters of reply sent by ORG of ORG ( ORG PERSON ) on DATE and DATE , and by ORG ( PERSON ) on DATE and DATE .

The letters in question have typewritten headings and text . In the space reserved for the name of the addressee and the address the words : “ ORG ” ( PERSON ) or “ Prison , PERSON . Getta Street no . DATE PERSON ( PERSON . PERSON . PERSON , CARDINAL - CARDINAL PERSON ) are typed in bold letters . The name of the addressee in these letters has been erased and CARDINAL of the letters in question have an empty space directly above the address . In the remaining CARDINAL letters , however , the applicant ’s own name has been handwritten in the empty space .
The letters in question contain replies of the relevant penitentiary authorities to complaints about irregularities in treating correspondence , which had been made by a prisoner detained in ORG .
Moreover , the applicant brought a civil action under LAW . He sought compensation on account of overcrowding and resulting from it , inadequate living and sanitary conditions in FAC .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed the applicant ’s claim for compensation . The applicant failed to lodge an appeal in compliance with procedural requirements . On DATE ORG rejected his application for leave to lodge an appeal out of time .
